snippet: Erica J. Sison, the head quarantine officer at Newark Airport, has been on an increased lookout for symptoms of Ebola since a outbreak in West Africa that has killed nearly 1,000 people.
abstract: Erica J Sison, head quarantine officer at Newark Airport, is keeping close watch on passengers arriving in United States who may have symptoms of Ebola after outbreak in West Africa kills nearly 1,000 people; her job is part of increased border security at 18 airports and two border crossings.
lead_paragraph: Erica J. Sison, the head quarantine officer at Newark Airport, has been on an increased lookout for symptoms of Ebola since a outbreak in West Africa that has killed nearly 1,000 people.

headline.main: A Front Line Against Ebola Runs Through Newark’s Terminal B
headline.print_headline: An Ebola Front Line at Newark’s Terminal B

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
